com.honeybadger

Class HoneyBadgerActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.honeybadger.HoneyBadgerFragment

  • public class HoneyBadgerActivity
extends Activity

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Called when the activity is first created; it ensures that the IPTables is installed, generates and launches a script string based on settings, sets the view, and creates buttons for launching ViewRulesActivity, EditRulesActivity, and ViewLogActivity.
      boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
      Launches an options menu when the device options button is selected.
      boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
      Used to handle selection of items in options menu.
      void sendNotification()
      Used to send system notification that the IPTables binary has been installed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HoneyBadgerActivity

        public HoneyBadgerActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when the activity is first created; it ensures that the IPTables is installed, generates and launches a script string based on settings, sets the view, and creates buttons for launching ViewRulesActivity, EditRulesActivity, and ViewLogActivity.

      • sendNotification

        public void sendNotification()
        Used to send system notification that the IPTables binary has been installed. This is done by starting the HoneyBadgerNotify activity.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        Launches an options menu when the device options button is selected. The basic structure of this method is from the book Pro Android 2.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Used to handle selection of items in options menu. Starts activity for selected item. If "Settings" is selected, then EditPreferencesActivity is started. If "Clear Log" is selected, then LogDBAdapter is used to clear the log. If "Add Rule" is selected, then EditRulesActivity is started.
